intro: Pinalia sublobulata, commonly known as the narrow-lobed pinalia, is a herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
